description: Full club. In addition to the weight room, each facility has a hair salon, outstanding indoor and outdoor pool, basketball and handball courts. It even has rock climbing. The cafe is above average and worth a visit. The down side is this all comes for a price. And it at least for this reviewer, it seemed that I was paying for amenities that I would never use.

Very similar vibe with LifeTime fitness. Well almost. It seems to be 85% of what Lifetime fitness is. Like LifeTime it is a national chain and your membership is good every where. So if you travel it is a good choice

An icon since the early days of weigh training and Arnold, Gold's gym is a no-nonsense, progressive lifting gym. Ample equipment, free weights and generally a serious trainers place. The pricing is great also. However, while Gold's is global, they are franchises and when visiting other gyms there is a guess member fee. If you are a serious lifter this should be on your short list.
The gym for the people who despise the gym atmosphere. While I understand the reaction to the over the top gym bro, I find the atmosphere opressive.
Modelled very closely to Gold's gym. Another good option for the serious lifter and good alternative to Gold's if the location is more convenient.
